decoration.name: decoration
decoration.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: decoration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the activity of making something look more attractive by putting things on it or around it, or something that you use to do this
trans_examp.trans_cn: 装饰，装潢；装饰品，装饰物

example.eg: He's good at cake decoration.
example.egtrans: 他擅长做蛋糕装饰。

example.eg: Christmas/party/table/cake decorations
example.egtrans: 圣诞／聚会／餐桌／蛋糕装饰

trans_examp.trans_en: the activity of covering the walls or other surfaces of rooms or buildings with paint or paper

example.eg: This place is badly in need of decoration.
example.egtrans: 这个地方急需粉刷一下。

dsense.name: decoration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a medal given to someone and worn as an honour
trans_examp.trans_cn: （作为荣誉而佩戴的）奖章，勋章

example.eg: The Victoria Cross and George Cross are British decorations for bravery.
example.egtrans: 维多利亚十字勋章和乔治十字勋章是英国对英勇行为的嘉奖。

transitive.name: transitive
transitive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a verb) having or needing an object

example.eg: In this dictionary, transitive verbs, such as "put", are marked [T].
example.egtrans: 在这本词典中，像 put 这样的及物动词都用 [T] 标记。

transitive.name: transitive
transitive.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a transitive verb

mechanic.name: mechanic
mechanic.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: mechanic
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone whose job is repairing the engines of vehicles and other machines

example.eg: a car/garage/bike mechanic
example.egtrans: 汽车/自行车修理工

dsense.name: mechanic
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the study of the effect of physical forces on objects and their movement

dsense.name: mechanic
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the way something works or happens

example.eg: He knows a lot about the mechanics of running a school.
example.egtrans: 关于如何管理一所学校，他所知甚多。

receipt.name: receipt
receipt.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: receipt
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of paper that proves that money, goods, or information have been received

example.eg: Make sure you are given a receipt for everything you buy.
example.egtrans: 买什么东西都一定记着要发票。

dsense.name: receipt
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act or state of receiving money or goods

example.eg: Goods will be delivered on receipt of payment (= after the money is received).
example.egtrans: 款到即发货。

example.eg: You have been in receipt of unemployment benefit for two months.
example.egtrans: 你领失业救济金已经两个月了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the amounts of money received during a particular period by a business

example.eg: The theatre's receipts for the winter were badly down.
example.egtrans: 该剧院冬季的收入大幅下降。

protect.name: protect
protect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep someone or something safe from injury, damage, or loss

example.eg: clothing that protects you against the cold
example.egtrans: 御寒的衣服

example.eg: It's important to protect your skin from the harmful effects of the sun.
example.egtrans: 保护皮肤不受太阳的伤害是很重要的。

example.eg: Surely the function of the law is to protect everyone's rights.
example.egtrans: 法律的作用当然是保护每个人的权利。

example.eg: Of course the company will act to protect its financial interests in the country if war begins.
example.egtrans: 如果战争爆发，这个公司当然会采取行动保护自己在该国的经济利益。

example.eg: Patients' names have been changed to protect their privacy.
example.egtrans: 病人的名字被改换了以保护他们的隐私。

example.eg: Public pressure to protect the environment is strong and growing.
example.egtrans: 公众要求保护环境的呼声越来越强烈。

example.eg: Vitamin C may help protect against cancer.
example.egtrans: 维生素C可能有助于抗癌。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a government protects a part of its country's trade or industry, it helps it by taxing goods from other countries.
to provide someone with insurance against injury, damages, etc.

dynamic.name: dynamic
dynamic.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: dynamic
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a lot of ideas and enthusiasm
trans_examp.trans_cn: 思维活跃的；活泼的，充满活力的，精力充沛的

example.eg: She's young and dynamic and will be a great addition to the team.
example.egtrans: 她年轻活泼，会给团队增添不少活力。

example.eg: We need a dynamic expansion of trade with other countries.
example.egtrans: 我们需要大力发展与其他国家的贸易。

dsense.name: dynamic
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: continuously changing or developing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不断变化的；不断发展的

example.eg: Business innovation is a dynamic process.
example.egtrans: 商业革新是一个不断变化发展的过程。

example.eg: The situation is dynamic and may change at any time.
example.egtrans: 局势不稳定，可能随时发生变化。

dsense.name: dynamic
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to forces that produce movement

example.eg: a dynamic force
example.egtrans: 动力

get rid of.name: rid
get rid of.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not now have an unwanted or unpleasant task, object, or person

example.eg: I didn't enjoy marking those papers and I was glad to be rid of them.
example.egtrans: 我不喜欢批改那些卷子，所以我很高兴能免去这一麻烦。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to remove or throw away something unwanted

example.eg: That cream got rid of my skin rash.
example.egtrans: 那种药膏治好了我身上的皮疹。

example.eg: I used weedkiller to get rid of the weeds in the garden.
example.egtrans: 我用了除草剂来除去花园里的杂草。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to sell an old or unwanted possession

example.eg: Have you managed to get rid of your old Volvo yet?
example.egtrans: 你处理掉你的旧沃尔沃车了吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to send away someone annoying or to persuade them to leave

example.eg: We got rid of our unwelcome guests by saying we had to go to bed.
example.egtrans: 我们说必须要上床睡觉了，这才把那一帮不受欢迎的客人打发走。

violate.name: violate
violate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to break or act against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
trans_examp.trans_cn: 违反，违背，违犯（尤指法律、协议、原则等）

example.eg: They were charged with violating federal law.
example.egtrans: 他们被控违犯了联邦法律。

example.eg: It seems that the troops deliberately violated the ceasefire agreement.
example.egtrans: 那些军队似乎是故意违反停火协议。

example.eg: The doctor has been accused of violating professional ethics.
example.egtrans: 那名医生被控违反了职业道德。

trans_examp.trans_en: to go, especially forcefully, into a place or situation which should be treated with respect and in which you are not wanted or not expected to be

example.eg: The fishermen claimed that ships from another country had violated their territorial waters.
example.egtrans: 那些渔民宣称另一个国家的船只侵犯了他们的水域。

example.eg: Questions of this kind violate my privacy and I am not willing to answer them.
example.egtrans: 这种问题侵犯了我的隐私，我拒绝回答。

trans_examp.trans_en: to rape someone

example.eg: She said that she had been treated so roughly by the hospital staff that she felt violated.
example.egtrans: 她说医护人员待她非常粗暴，她感觉受到了侮辱。

underscore.name: underscore
underscore.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en:
to 
        
         underline
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指为了强调）在（词语）下面画线

underscore.name: underscore
underscore.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the character _ on a computer keyboard, used to draw a line under a letter or word, and also used in file names where a space is not allowed

mechanism.name: mechanism
mechanism.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: mechanism
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a machine, or a set of parts that work together

example.eg: These automatic cameras have a special focusing mechanism.
example.egtrans: 这些自动相机有特殊的对焦装置。

dsense.name: mechanism
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of doing something that is planned or part of a system

example.eg: The mechanism for collecting taxes needs revising.
example.egtrans: 收税制度需要修改。

dsense.name: mechanism
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of your behaviour that helps you to deal with a difficult situation

example.eg: She's actually kind of insecure, and her rudeness is just a defence mechanism.
example.egtrans: 她其实很缺乏安全感，她的粗鲁不过是出于防卫心理。

license.name: license
license.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
US spelling of 
        
         licence

license.name: license
license.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give someone official permission to do or have something

example.eg: Several companies have been licensed to sell these products.
example.egtrans: 一些公司获得了这些产品的销售许可。

conclude.name: conclude
conclude.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: conclude
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to end a speech, meeting, or piece of writing

example.eg: She concluded the speech by reminding us of our responsibility.
example.egtrans: 她在演讲结束时提醒我们所担负的责任。

example.eg: Before I conclude, I'd like to thank you all for coming.
example.egtrans: 在结束发言前，我想感谢诸位的光临。

example.eg: The concert concluded with a rousing chorus.
example.egtrans: 音乐会以激动人心的大合唱结束。

trans_examp.trans_en: to complete an official agreement or task, or arrange a business deal

dsense.name: conclude
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to judge or decide something after thinking carefully about it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 断定；决定；推断出；作出（结论）

example.eg: The jury concluded from the evidence that the defendant was innocent.
example.egtrans: 陪审团依据证据判裁决告无罪。

example.eg: The discussions continued late into the night, but nothing was concluded.
example.egtrans: 一直谈到深夜，可是没有作出任何决定。

community.name: community
community.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the people living in one particular area or people who are considered as a unit because of their common interests, social group, or nationality

example.eg: He's well known in the local community.
example.egtrans: 他在当地非常出名。

example.eg: There's a large black/white/Jewish community living in this area.
example.egtrans: 在该地区有一个大的黑人／白人／犹太人社区。

example.eg: Her speech caused outrage among the gay community.
example.egtrans: 她的演说激起了同性恋群体的愤怒。

example.eg: Drug trafficking is a matter of considerable concern for the entire international community (= all the countries of the world).
example.egtrans: 毒品走私是整个国际社会都相当关注的问题。

example.eg: There's a real sense of community (= caring and friendly feeling) in this neighbourhood.
example.egtrans: 在该地区有一种真正的社区归属感。

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of animals or plants that live or grow together

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the general public

example.eg: Unlike the present government, we believe in serving the community.
example.egtrans: 与现任政府不同，我们信奉服务大众。

knowledge.name: knowledge
knowledge.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: understanding of or information about a subject that you get by experience or study, either known by one person or by people generally
trans_examp.trans_cn: 知识；学问；学识；了解；理解

example.eg: Her knowledge of English grammar is very extensive.
example.egtrans: 她的英语语法知识很广博。

example.eg: He has a limited knowledge of French.
example.egtrans: 他对法语所知有限。

example.eg: The details of the scandal are now common knowledge (= familiar to most people).
example.egtrans: 丑闻的详情现在众所周知。

example.eg: She started to photograph the documents, safe in the knowledge that (= knowing that) she wouldn't be disturbed for at least an hour.
example.egtrans: 她开始对文件拍照，确信至少一小时内不会有人打扰。

example.eg: In this town there are only a couple of restaurants that to my knowledge (= judging from my personal experience and information) serve good food.
example.egtrans: 据我所知，这个镇上只有几家餐馆菜品不错。

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of knowing about or being familiar with something

example.eg: They both deny all knowledge of the affair.
example.egtrans: 他们俩完全否认知道此事。

example.eg: It has come/been brought to our knowledge (= we have discovered) that several computers have gone missing.
example.egtrans: 我们发现有几台电脑不见了。

matrix.name: matrix
matrix.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: matrix
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the set of conditions that provides a system in which something grows or develops

example.eg: Europe is remaking itself politically within the matrix of the European Community.
example.egtrans: 欧洲将在欧共体的环境下重塑政治版图。

dsense.name: matrix
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of numbers or other symbols arranged in a rectangle that can be used together as a single unit to solve particular mathematical problems

dsense.name: matrix
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a substance in which other things are fixed, buried, etc.

example.eg: The fossils lie embedded in a matrix of shale and sandstone.
example.egtrans: 化石牢牢嵌在页岩与砂岩形成的脉石中。

assignment.name: assignment
assignment.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of work given to someone, typically as part of their studies or job
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指学习或工作方面的）任务，作业

example.eg: a freelance/photo assignment
example.egtrans: 自由职业／摄影任务

example.eg: I have a lot of reading assignments to complete before the end of term.
example.egtrans: 期末前我有大量阅读作业要完成。

trans_examp.trans_en: a job that someone is sent somewhere to do

example.eg: a foreign/diplomatic assignment
example.egtrans: 外交任命

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of giving a particular job or piece of work to someone, or of sending someone to a chosen place to do a job

example.eg: assignment of the various tasks
example.egtrans: 各种任务的分配

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: Someone who is on assignment is doing a particular job or piece of work, usually in a particular place where they have been sent for a period of time.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 执行任务；（通常指被派遣到特定地点从事一段时间的）工作

example.eg: Both journalists were killed by terrorists while on assignment in the region.
example.egtrans: 两名记者在派往这一地区工作期间被恐怖分子杀害。

privilege.name: privilege
privilege.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an advantage that only one person or group of people has, usually because of their position or because they are rich
trans_examp.trans_cn: （特定个体或群体的）特权，特别待遇

example.eg: Healthcare should be a right, not a privilege.
example.egtrans: 医疗保健应该是权利，而非特权。

example.eg: Senior management enjoy certain privileges, such as company cars and health insurance.
example.egtrans: 高级管理层享受公司配车和私人医疗保健等特权。

trans_examp.trans_en: an opportunity to do something special or enjoyable

example.eg: I had the privilege of interviewing Picasso in the 1960s.
example.egtrans: 我在20世纪60年代很荣幸地采访到了毕加索。

example.eg: It was a real privilege to meet her.
example.egtrans: 见到她真是莫大的荣幸。

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which rich people or people from a high social class have most of the advantages in society
trans_examp.trans_cn: （富人或有权势者的）特权，特别待遇

example.eg: a life of privilege
example.egtrans: 特权生活

trans_examp.trans_en: the special right that some people in authority have that allows them to do or say things that other people are not allowed to

example.eg: diplomatic/parliamentary privilege
example.egtrans: 外交／议会言论特权

transparent.name: transparent
transparent.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: transparent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a substance or object is transparent, you can see through it very clearly.

example.eg: Grow the bulbs in a transparent plastic box, so the children can see the roots growing.
example.egtrans: 把球茎种在透明的塑料盒里，这样孩子们就能看到根的生长。

example.eg: Her blouse was practically transparent!
example.egtrans: 她的衬衫几乎是透明的！

dsense.name: transparent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: clear and easy to understand or recognize
trans_examp.trans_cn: 清楚易懂的；显而易见的

example.eg: I think we should try to make the instructions more transparent.
example.egtrans: 我觉得我们应该尽可能使指令更清楚易懂些。

dsense.name: transparent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: open and honest, without secrets
trans_examp.trans_cn: 公开和诚实的，无秘密的

example.eg: We are committed to being totally transparent about our charges.
example.egtrans: 我们致力于让收费完全透明。

majority.name: majority
majority.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: majority
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the larger number or part of something

example.eg: The majority of the employees have university degrees.
example.egtrans: 大部分雇员都有大学文凭。

example.eg: A large majority of people approve of the death sentence.
example.egtrans: 大多数人赞成死刑。

example.eg: In Britain women are in the/a majority.
example.egtrans: 在英国，女性占多数。

trans_examp.trans_en: in an election, the difference in the number of votes between the winning person or group and the one that comes second
trans_examp.trans_cn: 多数票（选举中胜者与第二名之间的选票差额）

example.eg: The Democratic candidate won by a narrow/large majority.
example.egtrans: 社会党人以微弱／绝对多数票胜出。

dsense.name: majority
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the age when you legally become an adult

example.eg: the age of majority
example.egtrans: 法定成年年龄

example.eg: She will inherit her father's estate when she reaches her majority.
example.egtrans: 她到法定年龄时将继承父亲的遗产。

leading.name: leading
leading.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: very important or most important

example.eg: a leading expert on the country's ecology
example.egtrans: 研究该国生态的顶级专家

example.eg: the world's leading manufacturer of audio equipment
example.egtrans: 世界顶级音响制造商

leading.name: leading
leading.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the lead (= type of metal) used to cover (parts of) a roof

manipulate.name: manipulate
manipulate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: manipulate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to control something or someone to your advantage, often unfairly or dishonestly
trans_examp.trans_cn: （常指以不正当手段）操纵，控制

example.eg: Throughout her career she has very successfully manipulated the media.
example.egtrans: 她在整个职业生涯中非常成功地控制了媒体。

example.eg: The opposition leader accused government ministers of manipulating the statistics to suit themselves.
example.egtrans: 反对派领导人指责政府部长篡改统计数据以满足自身利益。

dsense.name: manipulate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to control something using the hands

example.eg: The wheelchair is designed so that it is easy to manipulate.
example.egtrans: 轮椅设计得很容易用手控制。

trans_examp.trans_en: to treat a part of the body, using the hands to push back bones into the correct position and put pressure on muscles

example.eg: The doctor manipulated the base of my spine and the pain disappeared completely.
example.egtrans: 医生对我的脊柱底部进行了推拿，疼痛便完全消失了。

expectation.name: expectation
expectation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the feeling that good things are going to happen in the future

example.eg: The holiday lived up to all our expectations (= was as good as we were expecting).
example.egtrans: 假期过得一点也没有让我们失望。

example.eg: I have high expectations for this job (= I believe it will be good).
example.egtrans: 我对这份工作的期望值很高。

example.eg: We did so well - beyond all (= better than) our expectations.
example.egtrans: 我们做得非常好——远远超过了我们的预期。

example.eg: I think she had unrealistic expectations of motherhood.
example.egtrans: 我觉得她对做妈妈的憧憬有些不切实际。

trans_examp.trans_en: the feeling of expecting something to happen

example.eg: Considering the injuries he's had there can be little expectation of him winning the race.
example.egtrans: 考虑到他的伤病，他赢得这场比赛的希望不大。

example.eg: Our expectations are that the UK will cut its interest rate.
example.egtrans: 我们预计英国会降低利率。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: different from what is expected
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 出乎所有人的预料；意想不到的是

example.eg: Contrary to all expectations, she was accepted by the academy.
example.egtrans: 意想不到的是，她竟然被学院录取了。

whether.name: whether
whether.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: (used especially in reporting questions and expressing doubts) if, or not
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤用于转述问题或表达疑问）是否

example.eg: I wasn't sure whether you'd like it.
example.egtrans: 我拿不准你是否喜欢它。

example.eg: She asked me whether I was interested in working for her.
example.egtrans: 她问我是否有兴趣为她工作。

example.eg: I'm wondering whether to have the fish or the beef.
example.egtrans: 我正在考虑是吃鱼还是吃牛肉。

example.eg: I doubt whether it'll work.
example.egtrans: 我怀疑这是否能起作用。

example.eg: I was merely questioning whether we have the money to fund such a project.
example.egtrans: 我只是想问问我们有没有钱来资助这样一个项目。

example.eg: It all depends on whether or not she has the time.
example.egtrans: 这完全取决于她是否有时间。

example.eg: Anyway, it's a good story, whether or not it's true.
example.egtrans: 不管怎么说，这是一个不错的说法，无论它是真是假。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: (used to introduce two or more possibilities) it is not important if
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （用于引出两种或多种可能性）不管…还是…；或者…或者…

example.eg: I'm going, whether she likes it or not.
example.egtrans: 不管她高不高兴我都要走。

example.eg: Someone has to tell her, whether it's you or me.
example.egtrans: 总得有人告诉她，不论是你还是我。

example.eg: Let's face it - you're going to be late whether you go by bus or train.
example.egtrans: 让我们面对现实吧——不论你是乘公共汽车还是火车，都要迟到的。

one-off.name: one-off
one-off.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that happens or is made or done only once

example.eg: Will you be doing more talks in the future or was that just a one-off?
example.egtrans: 你将来还要作多次的讲话还是只此一次？

one-off.name: one-off
one-off.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: happening only once

example.eg: They gave him a one-off payment to compensate for the extra hours that he had to work.
example.egtrans: 他们一次性支付给他一笔钱作为他必须加班的补偿。

definition.name: definition
definition.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: definition
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a statement that explains the meaning of a word or phrase

example.eg: a dictionary definition
example.egtrans: 词典中的定义

example.eg: What is the definition of "mood"?
example.egtrans: 单词 mood 的定义是什么？

trans_examp.trans_en: a description of the features and limits of something

example.eg: The legal definition of what is and what is not pornography is very unsatisfactory.
example.egtrans: 法律对什么是色情、什么不是色情的解释令人很不满意。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: because of its own features
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 根据自身特点；从本质上来讲

example.eg: Psychology is by definition an inexact science.
example.egtrans: 从本质上来讲，心理学不是一门精确的科学。

dsense.name: definition
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: how clear an image or sound is
trans_examp.trans_cn: （图像或声音的）清晰度，保真度

example.eg: The photograph lacks definition.
example.egtrans: 那张照片的清晰度很差。

mode.name: mode
mode.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: mode
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of operating, living, or behaving

example.eg: Each department in the company has its own mode of operation.
example.egtrans: 这家公司的每一个部门都有自己的运作方式。

example.eg: Railways are an important mode of transport for the economy.
example.egtrans: 铁路对经济而言是一种重要的运输方式。

example.eg: Switch your phone to silent mode.
example.egtrans: 把你的电话切换到静音模式。

dsense.name: mode
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the number or value that appears most often in a particular set
trans_examp.trans_cn: 众数（指某一组数字资料中出现次数最多的值）

dsense.name: mode
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: (especially of clothes) to be fashionable at a particular time

example.eg: Miniskirts were very much the mode in the 60s.
example.egtrans: 迷你裙在20世纪60年代风靡一时。

alias.name: alias
alias.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: used when giving the name that a person is generally known by, after giving their real name

example.eg: Malcolm Little, alias Malcolm X
example.egtrans: 他名为Malcolm Litt，也称Malcolm X。

alias.name: alias
alias.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a false name, especially one used by a criminal

example.eg: He travels under (= using) an alias.
example.egtrans: 他使用化名旅行。

vary.name: vary
vary.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: vary
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If things of the same type vary, they are different from each other, and if you vary them, you cause them to be different from each other.

example.eg: Salary scales vary between states/from state to state/according to state/with each state.
example.egtrans: 工资高低各州／州与州／不同的州／每个州都不同。

example.eg: The samples varied in quality but were generally acceptable.
example.egtrans: 这些样品质量有差异，但是大体上可以接受。

example.eg: We have tried several different approaches, with varying degrees of success.
example.egtrans: 我们尝试过不同的方法，成功率也不同。

dsense.name: vary
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change or cause something to change in amount or level, especially from one occasion to another

example.eg: My taste in classical music varies greatly/widely, but I usually prefer Mozart or Brahms.
example.egtrans: 我对各种古典音乐的喜好程度很不相同，但我通常比较喜欢莫扎特或勃拉姆斯的音乐。

example.eg: Some people give a regular monthly donation while others vary the amount they give.
example.egtrans: 有些人每月捐赠固定数目的钱款，而有些人每月捐赠的数额多少不一。

onward.name: onward
onward.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: moving forward to a later time or a more distant (= farther away) place

example.eg: the onward march of time
example.egtrans: 时间的推移

example.eg: If you are continuing on an onward flight, your bags will be transferred automatically.
example.egtrans: 如果你要转机继续飞行，你的行李也会自动转机。

onward.name: onward
onward.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en:
→ 
        
         onwards

adjust.name: adjust
adjust.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: adjust
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change something slightly, especially to make it more correct, effective, or suitable
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指为了使某物更正确、有效或合适而）调整；调节

example.eg: If the chair is too high you can adjust it to suit you.
example.egtrans: 如果椅子太高了，你可以把它调到适合你的高度。

example.eg: As a teacher you have to adjust your methods to suit the needs of slower children.
example.egtrans: 作为一名老师，你必须调整教学方法来适应那些学得较慢的孩子的需要。

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange your clothing to make yourself look tidy

example.eg: She adjusted her skirt, took a deep breath, and walked into the room.
example.egtrans: 她整了整裙子，深吸一口气，走进了房间。

dsense.name: adjust
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to become more familiar with a new situation

example.eg: I can't adjust to living on my own.
example.egtrans: 我不习惯独自生活。

example.eg: Her eyes slowly adjusted to the dark.
example.egtrans: 她的眼睛慢慢适应了黑暗。

example.eg: The lifestyle is so very different - it takes a while to adjust.
example.egtrans: 生活方式差别太大了，得过一段时间才能适应。

Incubation.name: incubation
Incubation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: incubation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process in which a bird, etc. keeps its eggs warm until the young come out, or the process in which an egg develops until the stage at which the young come out

example.eg: The incubation period varies depending on the time of year when the eggs were laid.
example.egtrans: 孵化期的长短取决于每年产卵的时间。

example.eg: The chemical makes eggshells so thin and porous that they break during incubation.
example.egtrans: 这种化学物质使蛋壳变得非常薄和多孔，以至于在孵化过程中会破裂。

dsense.name: incubation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process or period of time in which harmful bacteria or viruses increase in size or number in a person's or animal's body but do not yet produce the effects of disease

example.eg: In smallpox, there is an incubation period of 8–18 days between initial infection and first symptoms.
example.egtrans: 天花，从最初感染到出现第一个症状之间有8到18天的潜伏期。

example.eg: After about two weeks of incubation, symptoms begin.
example.egtrans: 大约两星期的潜伏期之后，症状开始出现。

feedback.name: feedback
feedback.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: feedback
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: information or statements of opinion about something, such as a new product, that can tell you if it is successful or liked

example.eg: Have you had any feedback from customers about the new soap?
example.egtrans: 有关新款肥皂你有没有收到顾客的反馈意见？

example.eg: positive/negative feedback
example.egtrans: 正面的／负面的反馈信息

dsense.name: feedback
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the sudden, high, unpleasant noise sometimes produced by an amplifier when sound it produces is put back into it

example.eg: Jimi Hendrix loved to fling his guitar around to get weird and wonderful sounds from the feedback.
example.egtrans: 吉米‧亨德里克斯喜欢用力弹拨他的吉他，这样扬声器的啸声中就会传出一种怪诞奇妙的声音。

trans_examp.trans_en: the return back into a machine or system of part of what it produces, especially to improve what is produced
trans_examp.trans_cn: 反馈（到机器或产出系统，以改良产品）

example.eg: Feedback from the sensors ensures that the car engine runs smoothly.
example.egtrans: 探测器的反馈能确保汽车引擎平稳运转。

anyway.name: anyway
anyway.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: whatever else is happening, without considering other things
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不管怎样；无论如何；仍然

example.eg: Of course I don't mind taking you home - I'm going that way anyway.
example.egtrans: 我当然可以把你送回家——反正我也是顺路。

example.eg: "I thought you said everyone had left." "Well, some of them have anyway."
example.egtrans: “你不是说所有人都走了？”“噢，反正有些人已经走了。”

example.eg: Her parents were opposed to her giving up her course, but she did it anyway.
example.egtrans: 她父母反对她放弃学业，但她还是没有听。

trans_examp.trans_en: In conversation, anyway is also used to change the subject, return to an earlier subject, or get to the most interesting point.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于谈话中表示改变话题、回到原来说的话题或者即将谈到最有趣的一点）对了，好吧，无论如何，反正

example.eg: Anyway, as I said, I'll be away next week.
example.egtrans: 好了，我说过了，我下周就要离开了。

example.eg: Anyway, in the end I didn't wear your jacket.
example.egtrans: 不管怎么说，我终究也没有穿你的夹克。

example.eg: What was he doing with so much of the company's money in his personal account anyway?
example.egtrans: 他把那么多的公司资金存在他个人账户里到底是在搞什么名堂？

trans_examp.trans_en: used to give a more important reason for something that you are saying
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于谈话中表示强调正在说的话）而且，加之，到底

example.eg: I don't have time to go, and anyway it's too expensive.
example.egtrans: 我没有时间去，再说，也太贵了。

inherit.name: inherit
inherit.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: inherit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to receive money, a house, etc. from someone after they have died

example.eg: Who will inherit the house when he dies?
example.egtrans: 他死后由谁继承房子？

example.eg: All her children will inherit equally.
example.egtrans: 她所有的子女将平分遗产。

dsense.name: inherit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be born with the same physical or mental characteristics as one of your parents or grandparents

example.eg: Rosie inherited her red hair from her mother.
example.egtrans: 罗茜那头红发遗传自她母亲。

dsense.name: inherit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to begin to have responsibility for a problem or situation that previously existed or belonged to another person
trans_examp.trans_cn: 接手，承担（遗留的问题等）

example.eg: When I took on the job of manager, I inherited certain financial problems.
example.egtrans: 我担任经理时接手了一些遗留的财务问题。

region.name: region
region.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular area or part of the world, or any of the large official areas into which a country is divided
trans_examp.trans_cn: 区域，地区；（国家的）行政区

example.eg: one of China's autonomous regions
example.egtrans: 中国的自治区之一

example.eg: the Nordic/Asia-Pacific region
example.egtrans: 北欧／亚太地区

example.eg: the Basque region
example.egtrans: 巴斯克地区

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of a country, especially one that has a particular characteristic or is known for something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （一个国家内）有…特色，以…知名的地区

example.eg: a wine/farming region
example.egtrans: 葡萄酒产区／农业区

example.eg: mountainous/coastal regions
example.egtrans: 山区／沿海地区

example.eg: There's a shortage of cheap housing in the region.
example.egtrans: 这一地区缺少廉价住房。

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular part of someone's body

example.eg: He said he had sharp pains in the stomach region/the region of the stomach.
example.egtrans: 他说他的胃部剧痛。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: approximately

example.eg: They estimate that the temperature yesterday was (somewhere) in the region of -30°C.
example.egtrans: 他们估计昨天的气温在零下30摄氏度左右。

example.eg: It will cost something in the region of $1 million.
example.egtrans: 花费估计为100万美元左右。

as soon as.name: soon
as soon as.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or within a short time; before long; quickly

example.eg: She'll soon be here./She'll be here soon.
example.egtrans: 她很快就到。

example.eg: It will soon be impossible for foreigners to enter the country.
example.egtrans: 不久以后，外国人就不能进入这个国家了。

example.eg: The sooner we leave, the sooner we'll get there.
example.egtrans: 我们出发得越早，到那儿也就越早。

example.eg: Soon after agreeing to go, she realized she'd made a mistake.
example.egtrans: 同意去之后不久，她就意识到自己犯了一个错误。

example.eg: How soon (= when) can we sign the contract?
example.egtrans: 我们什么时候能签订合同？

example.eg: "When would you like to meet?" "The sooner the better."
example.egtrans: “你想什么时候见面？”“越快越好。”

example.eg: I couldn't get out of that place soon enough.
example.egtrans: 我恨不得马上离开那个地方。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: at the same time or a very short time after

example.eg: As soon as I saw her, I knew there was something wrong.
example.egtrans: 我一看到她就知道出事了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you do something as soon as possible, you do it as quickly as you can.

example.eg: We need the repairs done as soon as possible.
example.egtrans: 我们需要尽快修好。

effort.name: effort
effort.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: physical or mental activity needed to achieve something

example.eg: If we could all make an effort to keep this office tidier it would help.
example.egtrans: 如果我们都努力保持整洁，那么办公室的面貌肯定会大有改观。

example.eg: You can't expect to have any friends if you don't make the effort with people.
example.egtrans: 如果不努力去和人们交往，你就别想有朋友。

example.eg: In their efforts to reduce crime the government expanded the police force.
example.egtrans: 为了减少犯罪，政府扩大了警察的队伍。

example.eg: He's jogging around the park every morning in an effort to get fit.
example.egtrans: 为了调整好身体状况，他现在每天早晨都绕着公园慢跑。

example.eg: It takes a long time to prepare the dish but the results are so good that it's worth the effort.
example.egtrans: 做这道菜很费时间，但结果大家都很爱吃，工夫真没白费。

trans_examp.trans_en: the result of an attempt to produce something, especially when its quality is low or uncertain
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指不理想的或难以确定的）结果

example.eg: Do you want to have a look at his exam paper? It's a fairly poor effort.
example.egtrans: 你想看看他的试卷吗？成绩可是不太好。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be difficult, tiring, or boring to do

example.eg: I'm exhausted all the time, and everything is a real effort.
example.egtrans: 我总是觉得精疲力尽，无论做什么都很费劲。

affect.name: affect
affect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: affect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have an influence on someone or something, or to cause a change in someone or something

example.eg: Both buildings were badly affected by the fire.
example.egtrans: 两座楼都在大火中严重受损。

example.eg: The divorce affected every aspect of her life.
example.egtrans: 离婚使她生活的各个方面都受到了影响。

example.eg: It's a disease that affects mainly older people.
example.egtrans: 这是一种主要侵扰老年人的疾病。

example.eg: I was deeply affected by the film (= it caused strong feelings in me).
example.egtrans: 我被电影深深地打动了。

dsense.name: affect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pretend to feel or think something

example.eg: To all his problems she affected indifference.
example.egtrans: 对他所有的问题，她都装作漠不关心的样子。

trans_examp.trans_en: to start to wear or do something in order to make people admire or respect you
trans_examp.trans_cn: （为引人注意或自抬身价而）刻意穿戴，故作

example.eg: At university he affected an upper-class accent.
example.egtrans: 在大学里他拿腔捏调假装上流社会口音。

example.eg: He's recently affected a hat and cane.
example.egtrans: 近来，他头上戴了顶帽子，手上拿了根拐杖，装腔作势起来。

enterprise.name: enterprise
enterprise.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: enterprise
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an organization, especially a business, or a difficult and important plan, especially one that will earn money
trans_examp.trans_cn: 组织；（尤指）公司，企业；（尤指营利性的、艰巨而重大的）计划，事业

example.eg: Don't forget this is a commercial enterprise - we're here to make money.
example.egtrans: 不要忘记这是一个商业组织——我们到这儿来是为了赚钱的。

example.eg: Those were the years of private enterprise (= businesses being run privately, rather than by the government), when lots of small businesses were started.
example.egtrans: 那是一个私人企业的时代，众多小公司就是那时创建的。

example.eg: Her latest enterprise (= plan) is to climb Mount Everest.
example.egtrans: 她最近的雄伟计划是攀登珠穆朗玛峰。

dsense.name: enterprise
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: eagerness to do something new and clever, despite any risks
trans_examp.trans_cn: 事业心；进取心；创业精神；冒险精神

example.eg: They've shown a lot of enterprise in setting up this project.
example.egtrans: 启动这个项目显示出他们豪迈的进取精神。

example.eg: We need someone with enterprise and imagination to design a marketing strategy.
example.egtrans: 我们需要一位有进取心和创新精神的人来为我们制定市场战略。

discard.name: discard
discard.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to throw something away or get rid of it because you no longer want or need it

example.eg: Discarded food containers and bottles littered the streets.
example.egtrans: 街上到处都是被丢弃的食品包装和瓶子。

trans_examp.trans_en: to get rid of a card you are holding during a card game

discard.name: discard
discard.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a card game, a card that you have got rid of

naked.name: naked
naked.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: naked
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not covered by clothes

example.eg: a naked man
example.egtrans: 赤身裸体的男子

example.eg: naked bodies
example.egtrans: 赤裸的身体

example.eg: stark naked (= completely naked)
example.egtrans: 一丝不挂

example.eg: buck/butt naked (= completely naked)
example.egtrans: 一丝不挂

example.eg: He was naked to the waist (= not wearing clothes above his waist).
example.egtrans: 他上身赤裸。

example.eg: The children were half naked (= partly naked).
example.egtrans: 孩子们半裸着身体。

example.eg: They stripped naked (= took off their clothes) and ran into the lake.
example.egtrans: 他们脱光衣服，奔向湖泊。

trans_examp.trans_en: Something that is naked does not have its usual covering.

example.eg: a naked flame/light bulb (= one with nothing surrounding or covering it)
example.egtrans: 明火／无罩灯泡

example.eg: a naked hillside (= one without trees or plants)
example.egtrans: 光秃秃的山坡

dsense.name: naked
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A naked feeling or quality is not hidden, although it is bad.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （感觉或特质）毫不掩饰的，明摆着的，赤裸裸的

example.eg: naked aggression/greed
example.egtrans: 赤裸裸的侵略／贪婪

integration.name: integration
integration.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: integration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the action or process of successfully joining or mixing with a different group of people

example.eg: racial/cultural integration
example.egtrans: 种族/文化融合

example.eg: To promote integration, several schools' catchment areas were merged.
example.egtrans: 为了促进融合，合并了几所学校的学区。

trans_examp.trans_en: the action or process of combining two or more things in an effective way

example.eg: He creates a seamless integration of contemporary and historic images.
example.egtrans: 他完成了当代和历史图像的无缝整合。

example.eg: The heads of government were trying to encourage regional integration.
example.egtrans: 各国政府首脑正努力鼓励区域一体化。

dsense.name: integration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of calculating the integral of a function

example.eg: Integration can be used to find areas, volumes, central points, and many other useful things in addition to finding the area under the graph of a function.
example.egtrans: 除了查找函数图形下的面积外，积分还可用于查找面积、体积、中心点和许多其他有用的东西。

inverse.name: inverse
inverse.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: opposite in relation to something else

example.eg: Their generosity was in inverse proportion/relation to their income (= the more money they had the less generous they were).
example.egtrans: 他们的慷慨程度与他们的收入水平成反比。

inverse.name: inverse
inverse.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the opposite

example.eg: Dividing by two is the inverse of multiplying by two.
example.egtrans: 除以2与乘以2正好相反。

gap.name: gap
gap.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: gap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an empty space or opening in the middle of something or between two things

example.eg: The children squeezed through a gap in the wall.
example.egtrans: 孩子们从墙的一个缺口处硬挤了过去。

example.eg: She has a small gap between her front teeth.
example.egtrans: 她的门牙之间有条细缝。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an opportunity for a product or service that does not already exist

example.eg: There is a gap in the magazine market that needs to be filled.
example.egtrans: 在杂志市场上还有一个空白需要填补。

dsense.name: gap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a difference between two things

example.eg: The gap between rich and poor is still widening (= becoming greater).
example.egtrans: 贫富差距仍在继续拉大。

trans_examp.trans_en: a period of time spent doing something different

example.eg: After a gap of five years, Jennifer decided to go back to work full-time.
example.egtrans: 时隔5年之后，珍妮弗决定回去做全职工作。

exception.name: exception
exception.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone or something that is not included in a rule, group, or list or that does not behave in the expected way

example.eg: Men are usually quite good at map-reading but Tim is the exception.
example.egtrans: 通常男性都很会看地图，但蒂姆却是个例外。

example.eg: There are exceptions to every rule.
example.egtrans: 每条规则皆有例外。

example.eg: I like all kinds of movies with the exception of (= but not) horror movies.
example.egtrans: 除了恐怖片，各种电影我都爱看。

example.eg: Her books are always entertaining and this one is no exception.
example.egtrans: 她写的书总是妙趣横生，这本也不例外。

example.eg: You must report here every Tuesday without exception.
example.egtrans: 你每周二都必须来此报告，不得有例外。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not treat someone or something according to the usual rules

example.eg: We don't usually accept late applications, but in this case we will make an exception.
example.egtrans: 通常我们不受理逾期的申请，但这种情况下我们可以破一次例。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be offended or made angry by something or someone
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 因…而不悦；生…的气；因…而忿恨

example.eg: Why did you take exception to what he said? He was only joking.
example.egtrans: 你何必因为他说的那些话生气呢？他只不过是在开玩笑嘛。

complement.name: complement
complement.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something else seem better or more attractive when combining with it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 补充；补足；使完善；为…增色

example.eg: Strawberries and cream complement each other perfectly.
example.egtrans: 草莓加奶油相得益彰。

example.eg: The music complements her voice perfectly.
example.egtrans: 音乐完美地衬托出她的嗓音。

complement.name: complement
complement.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a clause that usually follows the verb in English and adds more information about the subject or object

hover.name: hover
hover.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay in one place in the air, usually by moving the wings quickly

example.eg: A hawk hovered in the sky, waiting to swoop down on its prey.
example.egtrans: 一只老鹰在天空中盘旋，要伺机俯冲捕捉猎物。

example.eg: I heard the noise of a helicopter hovering overhead.
example.egtrans: 我听到头顶上直升飞机盘旋的声音。

trans_examp.trans_en: to stand somewhere, especially near another person, eagerly or nervously waiting for their attention

example.eg: A waiter hovered at the table, ready to take our order.
example.egtrans: 一名侍者守在桌子旁，等着我们点菜。

example.eg: I could sense him behind me, hovering and building up the courage to ask me a question.
example.egtrans: 我能感觉到他在我身后犹豫徘徊，想鼓起勇气问我一个问题。

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay at or near a particular level

example.eg: Inflation is hovering at three percent.
example.egtrans: 通货膨胀率在3%左右徘徊。

trans_examp.trans_en: to put the cursor on a computer screen in a particular place without clicking on it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 把光标放在电脑屏幕上的某个位置

example.eg: The link changes to green when the mouse hovers over it.
example.egtrans: 当光标放在链接文字上时，文字会变成绿色。

example.eg: If you hover the mouse pointer over the entry, the full web address will be displayed.
example.egtrans: 当你把光标放在这条记录上时，整个网站地址就会显示出来。

curate.name: curate
curate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a priest of the lowest rank, especially in the Church of England, whose job is to help the vicar (= priest of a particular area)
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指英国国教会的）助理牧师

curate.name: curate
curate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be in charge of selecting and caring for objects to be shown in a museum or to form part of a collection of art, an exhibition, etc.

example.eg: She curated a recent exhibition of Indian artwork.
example.egtrans: 她最近策划了一个印度艺术展。

readable.name: readable
readable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: easy and enjoyable to read
trans_examp.trans_cn: 易懂的；读起来有趣的；可读性强的

example.eg: It is an excellent and highly readable account of the army today.
example.egtrans: 它精彩地描述了现代军队的情况，可读性很强。

readable.name: -readable
readable.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in a form that is able to be used by a computer
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 可机读的，可由计算机读取的

example.eg: Machine-readable passports will permit precise identity-checking.
example.egtrans: 计算机读取护照将使准确的身份验证成为可能。

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to or expressed in a system of counting based on the number ten

example.eg: If you calculate the result to two decimal places (= give two numbers after the decimal point, as in 3.65), that should minimize any possible errors.
example.egtrans: 如果将计算结果保留两位小数，就会最大限度地减小可能的误差。

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number expressed using a system of counting based on the number ten

example.eg: Three fifths expressed as a decimal is 0.6.
example.egtrans: 3/5用小数表示就是0.6。
